newsitem.title: USA: Gilbert completes purchase of TEC Cellular.
newsitem.headline: Gilbert completes purchase of TEC Cellular.

text.p: Gilbert Associates said Tuesday the effects of its recent acquisition of TEC Cellular Inc on earnings per share will be neutral to slightly accretive in 1997 and accretive by $0.10 to $0.15 in 1998.

The $14 million transaction will be accounted for as a purchase, Gilbert said. TEC, which makes software and provides engineering services for the wireless communications industry, will become a division of Gilbert's SAFCO Technologies unit.

As a result of the TEC purchase, Gilbert expects to incur a net after tax non-cash charge of $5.5 to $7.5 million in the second quarter of fiscal year 1997 for the write down of in-process research and development.
Gilbert also said it agreed to purchase all of the outstanding stock of DAC Ltd from Ropner Plc, a unit of Jacobs Holdings Plc.

Gilbert will purchase DAC Ltd, which is based in Burton VUpon Trent, England, from Ropner Plc for about three million pounds. The transaction is expected to be neutral to Gilbert's earnings per share in 1997 and slightly accretive in 1998.
DAC Ltd's primary products include specialized industrial telephones for use in harsh environments such as roadsides, railroads and oil and gas exploration and processing.
The company also makes and markets systems used for operational and safety communications in the mining industry.
